newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH CABINET APPROVES DRAFT AGRICULTURE LAW.
newsitem.headline: CZECH CABINET APPROVES DRAFT AGRICULTURE LAW.

text.p: The Czech cabinet on Monday approved a draft agricultural law on Monday countering a plan by the lower house of parliament which won approval in its first of three required readings last week.

Government spokesman Ivo Strejcek told a news conference after the cabinet session that Agriculture Minster Josef Lux would draw up the final version of the draft and present it to parliament by the end of January.
He did not elaborate on the draft, but the local news agency CTK reported it includes a declaration of support of the state for a long-term basic food self-sufficiency of the country.
It added the proposal also includes compensations for farmers whose production is limited by other laws interfering into agriculture on their land.

The senior Civic Democratic Party (ODS), a leader of a three-party minority coalition, said last week it would leave the government if the parliament approved opposition Social Democrats' proposals on agriculuture and pensions .
Several deputies of Lux's centrist Christian Democrats (KDU-CSL) supported the opposition proposals and allowed them to move forward for further consideration in the February session of parliament.
The opposition proposals call for stronger state intervention to help the agricultural sector.
